Configure Project/LDAP Configuration

Use the LDAP Configuration pane of the Configure Project dialog box (Admin | Configure Project | General tab | Security | LDAP Configuration) to configure Serena ChangeMan Version Manager for use with a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) authentication server. To make use of this feature, you must:

  • Have a functional LDAP server
  • Select LDAP ID as one of your login sources

Field Descriptions

Security | LDAP Configuration
Use SSL (Secure Socket Layer) Select to enable the Secure Socket Layer.
Follow Referrals Select to allow Version Manager to follow referrals from one LDAP server to another. Use this feature to support properly configured non-redundant distributed servers.
Base User Context Enter the base user context (distinguished name). This is the base from which to search for users.
User Naming Attribute Select a user naming attribute. This is the attribute in which the LDAP server holds the user ID value.
Bind Anonymously Select to anonymously query the LDAP server for the list of users. This requires that the LDAP server is configured to allow anonymous users to retrieve a list of users and attributes.

NOTE You cannot bind anonymously to a Microsoft Active Directory Server.
User DN Enter a full user DN in the User DN field, if your are not binding anonymously.
Password Enter a user password in the Password field, if your are not binding anonymously.
Connection Timeout Enter a value to set the idle time in seconds before the connection to the LDAP server times out.
Apply Click to apply the settings without closing the dialog box.
OK Click to apply the settings and close the dialog box.
